com.serfshack.jobwrangler.core

Class Job<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.serfshack.jobwrangler.core.Dependable
      • com.serfshack.jobwrangler.core.Job<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The job's result type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleJob

    public abstract class Job<T>
extends Dependable
    Base class for Jobs.

      • addDepended

        public void addDepended(Dependable dependable)
        Add a hard dependency with the CASCADE_FAILURE DependencyFailureStrategy.
        Overrides:
        addDepended in class Dependable
        Parameters:
        dependable - The depended
        Throws:
        DependencyCycleException - Adding this dependency would create a cycle
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The proposed dependency is not active in the JobManager

      • addDepended

        public void addDepended(Dependable dependable,
                        Dependable.DependencyFailureStrategy inheritFailure)
        Add a dependency with the specified DependencyFailureStrategy.
        Overrides:
        addDepended in class Dependable
        Parameters:
        dependable - The depended
        inheritFailure - The DependencyFailureStrategy to apply. Overwrites any existing DependencyFailureStrategy.
        Throws:
        DependencyCycleException - Adding this dependency would create a cycle
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The proposed dependency is not active in the JobManager

      • init

        public void init(JobManager jobManager)
        Initialize with a JobManager instance.
        Parameters:
        jobManager -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Job is already initialized
        java.lang.NullPointerException - JobManager must not be null
        DependencyCycleException - Adding this Dependable to the provided JobManager would result in a dependency cycle

      • configureRunPolicy

        protected RunPolicy configureRunPolicy()
        Every job has one RunPolicy that governs its lifecycle. See RunPolicy
        Returns:
        A new RunPolicy to be applied to the job. Called once as part of initializing the job, or as part of inflating a persisted job as the RunPolicy itself is not persisted.

      • isRemovable

        protected boolean isRemovable()
        Determine if it's safe to remove a Job from the graph. Some jobs may want to override this to persist in a faulted state.
        Returns:
        True if the job is in a terminal state and no non-removable jobs depend on this one.

      • getState

        public final State getState()
        Specified by:
        getState in class Dependable
        Returns:
        The job's current state. Note that all state transitions happen asynchronously on the Job Service thread, so calling getState() immediately after setState() may return unexpected results. setState() returns a gettable Future to help with timing issues.

      • getStateMessage

        public java.lang.String getStateMessage()
        Returns:
        An unstructured text message about the current state, typically for logging.

      • cancel

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<State> cancel()
        Cancel the job
        Returns:
        A gettable Future State, allowing a blocking call to read the final state. This will either be CANCELED (the usual case) or SUCCEEDED (the Job can't be canceled because it already completed successfully). Note it is legitimate to cancel a job in the FAULTED state.

      • getTotalDuration

        public long getTotalDuration()

      • getObserver

        public JobObserver<T> getObserver()
        Returns:
        The JobObserver associated with this job, creating one if necessary.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Override to provide a friendly description of this Job for logging purposes.
        Overrides:
        getDescription in class Dependable
        Returns:
        The default description is "[classname] [state] [stateMessage]"

        see toString()

      • getRunPolicy

        public final RunPolicy getRunPolicy()
        Accessor for the Job's RunPolicy
        Returns:
        the RunPolicy, or null

      • isCanceled

        public final boolean isCanceled()
        Returns:
        True if the Job has been canceled.

      • getResult

        protected T getResult()
        Returns:
        The Job's result value as set by setResult()

      • getResultBlocking

        protected T getResultBlocking(long t,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Convenience function that combines waitForTerminalState() and getResult().
        Parameters:
        t - Max time to wait
        timeUnit - Units for t
        Returns:
        The Job's result, as passed to Job.setResult() on Job completion.

      • setResult

        protected void setResult(T result)
        Set the job's result, if applicable.
        Parameters:
        result -

      • onAdded

        protected State onAdded()
        Callback, called once when the Job is submitted. Useful for writing a local representation of the job to any UI or database.

        Called from the main Job Service thread. Avoid blocking operations.

        Returns:
        The desired state, typically READY indicating the job is set to proceed to onPrepare(). SUCCEEDED, FAULTED, CANCELED are also allowed.

      • onNewJobAdded

        protected void onNewJobAdded(Job newjob)
        Callback, called after any new job has been successfully added to the JobManager.

        Called from the main Job Service thread. Avoid blocking operations.

        Parameters:
        newjob - The job that was added. Any action may be taken here including canceling or modifying the new job or the current one. May be useful if ConcurrencyPolicy logic is not sufficient to manage the situation.

      • onJobAssimilated

        protected void onJobAssimilated(Job assimilating,
                                Job assimilated)
        Callback, called after any other job gets assimilated. This takes care of removing the assimilated job from the job's dependencies and replacing it with the assimilating one.
        Parameters:
        assimilated - The job moved to the ASSIMILATED state
        assimilating - The surviving job

      • onStateChanged

        protected void onStateChanged(State oldState)
        Callback, called after any state transition, so getState() will return the new state.

        Called from the main Job Service thread. Avoid blocking operations.

        Parameters:
        oldState - The previous state

      • onPrepare

        protected State onPrepare()
        Callback, called when the Job's RunPolicy and dependencies allow this job to proceed to the READY state. This lets the job do any other last-minute checks before proceeding. A call to doWork() is always gated by a call to onPrepare().

        Called from the main Job Service thread. Avoid blocking operations.

        Returns:
        The desired State:

        READY : Success is possible. doWork will be called immediately. WAIT : Job is not ready. onPrepare() will be called again on a backoff schedule. SUCCEEDED, FAULTED, CANCELED are also allowed.

        Note, this call does not count against any RunPolicy attempt limit.

      • doWork

        protected abstract State doWork()
        Callback, called when onPrepare() has returned READY. The Job's main work is done here.

        While doWork() is running, the job will be in the BUSY state.

        Called from a worker thread.

        Returns:
        The desired state: SUCCEEDED : Job completed READY/WAIT : Attempt failed, retry according to the RunPolicy schedule FAULTED/CANCELED : Job failed in a bad way, no retries will be scheduled BUSY : The job's work has started and continues asynchronously. See checkProgress()

        The return value will be validated against the Job's RunPolicy before transitioning the state. For example, returning READY when the attempt limit has been spent will result in a transition to the FAULTED state.

      • checkProgress

        protected State checkProgress()
        Callback, called periodically while the Job is in the BUSY state. This is useful when doWork() has started some asynchronous operation. In that case checkProgress() is called on a backoff schedule as allowed by the RunPolicy.

        Called from the main Job Service thread. Avoid blocking operations.

        Returns:
        The desired state: SUCCEEDED : Job completed READY/WAIT : Attempt failed, retry according to the RunPolicy schedule FAULTED/CANCELED : Job failed in a bad way, no retries will be scheduled BUSY : The Job is still working

        The return value will be validated against the Job's RunPolicy before transitioning the state.

      • onDependencyFailed

        protected State onDependencyFailed(Dependable failedDependency)
        Callback, called when a depended Job has faulted.

        Called from the main Job Service thread. Avoid blocking operations.

        Parameters:
        failedDependency -
        Returns:
        The desired state. In the default implementation, if the dependency relationship uses the CASCADE_FAILURE DependencyFailureStrategy, the depending job will also fail.

      • rollback

        protected void rollback()
        Callback, called when this job has been successfully added and subsequently moves to a FAULTED or CANCELED state. May be used to clean up things that were added in onAdded().

        Called on a worker thread.

      • assimilate

        public boolean assimilate(Job redundantJob)
        Callback, called when this Job's ConcurrencyPolicy has collided with another one, and this Job wins. Override this method so the surviving job to takes on the redundant job's work as necessary. Handy for use in throttling/debouncing schemes.

        This method is always called in the context of enqueueing either the redundant or the surviving job, depending on the ConcurrencyPolicy.

        Parameters:
        redundantJob - The job slated for assimilation
        Returns:
        true if the redundant job's work was absorbed successfully and should be moved to the terminal ASSIMILATED state. Return false to allow redundantJob to continue normally.
